qas.question: Which continent has similar plant and animal life as the British Isles?
In Ireland where does the native animal and plant species mostly come from?
When did the land bridge between Ireland and Britain disappear?
When did the last Ice Age end in the British Isles?
The islands have no soil and what kind of climate?
What type of life is similar to life in southern Asia?
The land bridge connecting two European continents was flooded by see about how many years ago?
The beginning of the last Ice Age occurred when?
Plant and animal life varies greatly from that of life in which continent?

context: The islands enjoy a <b4_0>mild<b4_0/> climate and varied soils, giving rise to a diverse pattern of vegetation. <b5_0>Animal and plant life<b5_0/> is similar to that of the northwestern <a0_0><b8_0>European continent<a0_0/>.<b8_0/> There are however, fewer numbers of species, with Ireland having even less. All native flora and fauna in Ireland is made up of species that migrated from elsewhere in <a1_0>Europe, and Great Britain<a1_0/> in particular. The only window when this could have occurred was between the end of the last Ice Age (<a3_0><b7_0>about 12,000 years ago<b7_0/><a3_0/>) and when the land bridge connecting the two islands was flooded by sea (<a2_0>about <b6_0>8,000<b6_0/> years ago<a2_0/>).
